article.headline: Fordham 61, Columbia 57
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Michael Haynes scored 14 points and had 10 rebounds to help Fordham snap a six-game losing streak with a 61-57 victory over Columbia on Tuesday night. Jermaine Anderson added 13 points for the Rams (3-9), who held a 34-24 advantage at halftime. Matt Preston was 13-of-14 from the free-throw line and finished with 25 points for the Lions (3-9), who lost their third straight. Fordham, led by Dominic Osei's 3-point basket and jump shot, opened the second half on an 18-8 run to gain its biggest lead, 52-32 with 10:49 left. Columbia responded with a 21-2 rally to get as close as 54-53 on Dragutin Kravic's layup at 2:53. The Rams went ahead 58-53 on a layup by Haynes at 1:38, but Preston's jumper and pair of free throws cut it to 58-57 with 30 seconds to play. Fordham scored the final three points from the foul line, two by Derrick Breland and one by Haynes.
